alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:14PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany, southwestern Goshen and Laramie Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Iron Mountain to near Pumpkin Vine. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Pine Bluffs, Burns, Albin, South Greeley, Hillsdale, Federal, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Meriden Rest Area, Gun Barrel, Carpenter, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 42. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 340 and 402. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
